course_description: This comprehensive beginner-level technical programming course provides a solid foundation in Python programming fundamentals. Students will master core concepts including variables, data types, control structures, functions, and basic object-oriented programming through hands-on coding exercises and real-world projects. Designed for those with little to no programming experience, this course emphasizes practical skills development and problem-solving techniques essential for modern software development.
course_overview: This course delivers a systematic introduction to Python programming, starting with environment setup and basic syntax. Students will write their first programs within the first hour, progressing to build a calculator application, a text-based adventure game, and a data analysis script. The curriculum covers variables and data types (strings, integers, floats, lists, dictionaries), control flow (if/else statements, for and while loops), functions with parameters and return values, file handling for reading and writing data, error handling with try/except blocks, and introduction to classes and objects. Each module includes coding challenges, debugging exercises, and a capstone project where learners develop a personal task manager application with persistent storage. The course uses Visual Studio Code as the primary IDE and introduces Git for version control basics. Assessment includes automated code reviews, peer programming sessions, and a final portfolio project demonstrating mastery of Python fundamentals.
target_audience: Specific personas include: (1) Career changers from non-technical fields seeking entry into software development, (2) University students requiring Python skills for STEM coursework, (3) Business analysts and data professionals looking to automate tasks and manipulate data, (4) Hobbyists and entrepreneurs wanting to build prototypes or automate personal projects, (5) Professionals in finance, marketing, or operations aiming to enhance productivity through scripting. Ideal candidates possess basic computer literacy, comfortable with file management and installing software, but have minimal to no prior programming experience.
prerequisites: Basic computer literacy (file management, software installation)
Access to a computer with internet connection
learning_outcomes: Define and implement variables, data types, and control structures to solve computational problems
Build functional Python programs incorporating functions, loops, and conditional logic
Create modular applications using functions and basic object-oriented programming principles
Analyze code behavior and debug syntax and logical errors using systematic troubleshooting techniques
Develop interactive command-line applications that process user input and persist data to files
Evaluate different approaches to problem-solving and select appropriate Python constructs for specific tasks
